RESOLVED_ENTITIES.members of the group: Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero, Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez, Jaime Gomez-Arroyo, and seven other undocumented aliens

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero: Defendant who pled guilty to transporting undocumented aliens for financial gain and acted as a guide into the United States, guiding a group of nine aliens including Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez, and had his base offense level enhanced due to recklessly creating a substantial risk of death or serious bodily injury. He is argued to not have engaged in reckless conduct similar to that listed in the guideline commentary. Garcia also provided inaccurate advice on journey length and was found by the district court to have placed individuals in a substantially risky situation. The district court found that he recklessly created a substantial risk of death. He represented to the group that the journey would be only one day.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez: undocumented female alien who died from probable heat stroke during the journey, caused by trudging through the hot South Texas desert in June, described as a 142-pound, normally developed and adequately nourished adult female in the autopsy report
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero, Alma Delia Si: group of nine aliens being guided by Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero for financial gain
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jaime Gomez-Arroyo: uncle of Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez who met with border patrol agents and remained behind with her when she became ill
